title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Auto PLI scheme on track to exceed ₹42,500 crore investment target: Govt
items.summary:
- Auto PLI scheme on track to surpass ₹42,500 crore target as manufacturers commit over ₹35,000 crore and 72 of 82 applicants have invested
- Eighteen firms met investment and 50% DVA thresholds; 5–10 more expected next year; bank guarantees may be invoked for remaining investments
- About ₹2,000 crore disbursed of ₹2,091 crore; scheme boosts localisation and EV manufacturing, benefiting MSMEs

items.title: India’s chip ambition takes flight with customers signing up
items.summary:
- India’s push is moving from policy to action as Tata Electronics signs manufacturing/assembly pacts with Intel and Rohm to produce in India.
- Apple and other global players are in talks to assemble and package components with Indian chip makers, with OSAT partnerships seen as a path to a domestic ecosystem.
- ISM validation is underway, with expected 2026 shop setups and a shift toward a mature, locally integrated supply chain driven by fabless players, auto and industrial electronics.

items.title: Delhi's rooftop solar push: Surya Ghar scheme, ₹17,000 cr upgrade to meet rising power demand
items.summary:
- Delhi aims to meet rising demand with rooftop solar expansion under Surya Ghar and a ₹17,000 crore three-year upgrade of transmission and distribution networks.
- The plan prioritizes rooftop solar on government buildings, wide household participation, and use of underutilized spaces like flyovers, with feasibility studies and constituency-level upgrades.
- Projected demand growth: current peak above 8,400 MW, rising to ~11,500–12,000 MW by 2030 and ~20,000 MW by 2040, with solar central to growth and reduced reliance on conventional power.

items.title: Centre pushes coal bed methane drive in unexplored areas
items.summary:
- India to accelerate CBM exploration in unexplored/abandoned coal areas, including de-coaled mines.
- CIL and subsidiaries seek leaseholds; Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) awards a CBM block in Jharkhand's Jharia.
- With ~92 tcf CBM across 12 states, policy support and tech investments aim to lift production from 2.27 to 5 MMSCMD by 2027-28 for energy security.

items.title: Pragati platform accelerates ₹85 lakh crore projects: PM Modi outlines 'reform, perform, transform' vision
items.summary:
- Modi said Pragati has accelerated projects worth over ₹85 lakh crore in the past decade, signaling governance transformation via reform, perform, transform.
- At the 50th Pragati meeting, five infrastructure projects (road, rail, power, water, coal) worth over ₹40,000 crore were reviewed, with PM SHRI schools proposed as a national outcome benchmark.
- Origin from Swagat in Gujarat: Pragati unites large projects and grievance redressal on one platform for review, resolution and follow-up.

items.title: Ministry in talks with states to give some drug cos more time for good manufacturing practices compliance
items.summary:
- Union health ministry may grant a six-month, case-by-case extension to implement revised Schedule M GMP norms for units that have submitted upgrade plans.
- Schedule M revisions (Dec 2023) tighten quality controls; deadlines: >₹250 crore turnover units from July 1, 2024; MSMEs by Jan 1, 2025, later to Dec 31, 2025.
- Industry warns hard deadlines could cause shortages and job losses; >60% of ~8,500 SMEs could shut without extension; stance depends on upgrade plans and state feedback.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh has emerged as a key hub for electronics manufacturing
items.summary:
- UP is emerging as a fast-growing electronics manufacturing hub with policy support, robust infra and clusters to attract investments.
- The Bharat Electronics Yatra and the 2026 electronica India/productronica editions in UP will boost demand-supply linkages, with 300+ exhibitors in Greater Noida.
- Stakeholders say platforms uniting government, industry and demand will strengthen regional clusters, domestic manufacturing and long-term electronics growth.

items.title: Delhi HC restrains manufacturer from infringing Britannia's 'Little Hearts' mark
items.summary:
- Delhi HC restrains Shri Swastik Organics from infringing Britannia's Little Hearts mark and 3D biscuit shape.
- Court found a prima facie case, irreparable harm, and directed delisting of infringing products on an e-commerce platform.
- Case listed for further hearing on May 21, 2026.

items.title: Government notifies first set of export promotion mission scheme
items.summary:
- MAS under the six-year Export Promotion Mission (EPM) with ₹4,531 crore for MAS within a ₹14,000 crore budget; total ₹25,060 crore EPM with reallocations possible.
- It targets MSMEs and first-time exporters, supporting participation in international fairs to ease trade finance and broaden global reach.
- An IEC-based exporter index will track performance over five years; cost-sharing starts at 60/40 (govt/private) and rises to 80% for priority sectors.

items.title: Govt extends safeguard duties on imports of steel products for 3 yrs to curb dumping
items.summary:
- India extends steel-import safeguards for three years, keeping a 12% duty in year 1 (Apr 2025–Apr 2026), 11.5% in year 2, and 11% in year 3.
- The DGTR probe followed a complaint by the Indian Steel Association on behalf of major producers to curb dumping and protect domestic capacity and supply.
- Market reaction saw gains in steel stocks; critics warn higher duties could raise raw material costs for users and MSMEs.

items.title: AI can turn blue-collar into gold: Anand Mahindra
items.summary: - AI is an accelerator that turns hands-on skills into premium assets as shop-floor workers partner with AI and data tools.\n- Mahindra’s skilling push—Young India Skills University, skill centers and Tech Mahindra academies—build high-tech proficiency with vocational mastery.\n- By 2025, focus on SUVs, farm equipment, electric three-wheelers and Mahindra Finance; AI-led mobility and a modern, future-ready brand.

items.title: Gen Z stands at the heart of India’s big manufacturing pivot
Rosatom supplies nuclear fuel to India for Kudankulam NPP’s Unit 3
items.summary: - Rosatom's Nuclear Fuel Division loaded the initial core for Kudankulam NPP Unit 3 under a full-lifetime fuel-supply contract for Units 3 and 4.\n- TVS-2M fuel has higher uranium mass, debris-filter improvements, and extends the fuel cycle to 18 months, cutting refueling outages.\n- Rosatom-India cooperation continues with ongoing fuel-cycle optimization and engineering services across the plant's life.

items.title: Partnr plans to nearly triple dark stores to 350–400 in two years
DRDO successfully conducts salvo launch of Pralay missile from Odisha coast
Factories don’t need more platforms, they need outcomes: Rockwell’s Dilip Sawhney on Industry 4.0
items.summary:
- Industry 4.0 fails when technology leads and context is missing; data must be actionable with thresholds, timing and impact to be trusted.
- Start with plant pain, deliver weeks-long wins in brownfield factories, and define data needs by solving a few business problems for managers.
- Build shop-floor oriented automation (AI/vision without line stoppages, predictive planning options) with measurement, cybersecurity and safety as core outcomes.

items.title: China's CXMT eyes $4.2 billion Shanghai listing to fund DRAM expansion
items.summary:
- CXMT aims to raise 29.5 billion yuan (~$4.2B) in a Shanghai IPO to fund DRAM capacity expansion and R&D. 
- Founded in 2016 with state backing, CXMT runs three 12-inch DRAM fabs in Beijing and Hefei, holding ~4% of global DRAM share in Q2, aiming to challenge Samsung, SK Hynix and Micron. 
- The company is pushing into high-bandwidth memory (HBM) with plans for HBM back-end packaging in Shanghai by end-2026, potentially profitable by 2026 depending on wafer supply and prices.

items.title: Premier Energies rakes in orders worth ₹2,307 crore in Q3 FY26
items.summary:
- Premier Energies secured new orders worth ₹2,307.30 crore in Q3 FY26 from domestic IPPs and Indian customers, with execution across FY27–FY28.
- Orders support capacity expansion to 10.6 GW solar cells and 11.1 GW solar modules by Sep 2026, improving revenue visibility.
- The company attributes the inflow to its manufacturing capabilities, technology roadmap, and backward integration within an integrated platform aligned with Atmanirbhar Bharat.

items.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products to curb cheap imports
items.summary:
- India imposes a three-year safeguard duty on select steel imports to shield domestic producers from cheap, substandard steel.
- The duty rates are 12% in year 1, 11.5% in year 2, and 11% in year 3; applies to imports from China, Vietnam and Nepal; stainless steel and some specialty products are exempt.
- The measure follows a DGTR recommendation after a sharp rise in imports causing injury; a 200-day tariff preceded it amid broader global trade frictions.

items.title: Scale-up phase awaits semicon, EMS companies as Centre deepens play
items.summary:
- India’s ISM 2.0 shifts from MOUs to action, driving a scale-up phase with a broader focus beyond silicon fabs to display fabs, advanced packaging, and specialty chemicals, plus a larger outlay and predictable incentives.
- Domestic value-chain deepening with localisation of camera modules, batteries, displays, and PCBs, signaling a local components ecosystem; the ECMS scheme is a milestone for electronics manufacturing.
- 2026 outlook: the mobile phone PLI ends in March 2026, with expectations of ECMS outcomes, progress on semiconductor projects, and stronger integration of Indian manufacturing into global production and export networks.

items.title: TSMC says started mass production of 'most advanced' 2nm chips
China-based OmniVision Integrated Circuits seeks to raise up to $617 million in HK listing
items.summary:
- OmniVision Integrated Circuits plans to raise up to HK$4.80 billion via a Hong Kong IPO, offering 45.8 million H shares at up to HK$104.80 per share.
- Final offer price due by Jan 9; the float signals continued appetite for Chinese tech listings in HK amid regulatory changes and ample liquidity.
- 2025 HK IPOs average first-day gains around 40%; HKEX data show HK$285.8 billion raised from 119 listings as of Dec 30, with CATL and Mixue Group among notable listings.

items.title: China's GigaDevice Semiconductor looks to raise over $600 million in HK IPO
items.summary:
- GigaDevice Semiconductor plans to raise up to HK$4.68 billion ($601.47 million) in a Hong Kong IPO, per a Wednesday filing.
- The offering comprises 28.9 million H shares at up to HK$162.00 per share, as Chinese AI and chip firms tap HK's IPO window.
- Separately, AI startup MiniMax Group is targeting up to HK$4.19 billion in its own Hong Kong IPO, per a separate filing.

Defence Secy holds talks with Vietnam Envoy on defence cooperation initiatives

Viksit Bharat’s power shift: India hits 500 GW landmark and 51% non-fossil energy capacity in 2025
Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal pushes ‘sweating existing assets’ to lift mineral output
items.summary:
- Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal urged faster expansion by boosting output from existing mining assets rather than pursuing new projects, noting that new mines can take 5–10 years.
- He highlighted India's heavy import dependence—about 99.9% of gold and 95% of copper—and called for private participation to unlock under-utilized domestic assets.
- Revival would hinge on targeted investment, technology, and entrepreneurial energy to raise production and move toward self-reliance for manufacturing and the energy transition.

items.title: Aimtron Electronics signs OEM pact with Aurassure for IoT weather monitoring systems
RSB Group targets 50% renewable energy use, 45% emissions cut by 2030
items.summary:
- RSB Group released its first Sustainability Report detailing energy efficiency, emissions reduction, water stewardship and waste management.
- Targets include 50% renewable energy use and a 45% emissions cut by 2030, plus 60% water neutrality by 2030.
- The decarbonisation roadmap focuses on scaling renewables, improving energy efficiency and deploying low-carbon tech, alongside workforce and community initiatives.

items.title: Union Civil Aviation Minister flags off next-generation helicopter Dhruv NG in Bengaluru
items.summary:
- Dhruv NG is a 5.5-tonne light twin-engine civil helicopter by HAL, with Shakti 1H1C engines, domestic maintenance, a glass cockpit and advanced avionics.
- 7.33 m3 cabin supports VIP/VVIP (4–6 pax, up to 14) or air-ambulance; max ~285 km/h, 630 km range, 3h40m endurance, ceiling ~6,000 m.
- Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu flagged off Dhruv NG at HAL, calling it a milestone for Indian aviation and Atmanirbhar Bharat.

items.title: US approves Samsung chipmaking tool shipments to China for 2026
items.summary:
- The U.S. granted Samsung Electronics an annual license to import chipmaking equipment for its Chinese facilities in 2026, following earlier revocations of some waivers.
- An annual export-approval system for chipmaking tools to China will apply after end-user exemptions for Samsung, SK Hynix and TSMC expire on December 31, requiring licenses for shipments thereafter.
- The move reflects a broader Trump administration effort to tighten controls on advanced U.S. technology to curb China's access, with no comment from the companies.

items.title: Tata Power arm commissions 1 GW DCR-compliant solar project for SJVN
items.summary:
- TP Renewable Energy Limited commissioned a 1,000 MW AC (1,400 MWp DC) DCR-compliant solar project for SJVN in Rajasthan (Bandarwala and Karnisar Bhatiyan), using domestically manufactured modules and high-temperature inverters.
- All 2.4 million modules were produced at TP Solar Limited’s Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu; project features DCR-compliant cells and mono-bifacial modules.
- Allocations: 500 MW to Rajasthan Urja Vikas/IT Services, 300 MW to J&K Power Limited, 200 MW to Uttarakhand Power Corporation; first-year ~2,454.84 MU; CO2 offset ~1.74 Mt; >300 local jobs and 25+ vendors; TPREL EPC portfolio ~4.9 GW; Tata Power renewables ~11.6 GW total.

items.title: GREW Solar wins 1,464 MW module supply order from NTPC Renewable Energy
items.summary:
- GREW Solar secured a ₹2,028 crore contract to supply 1,464.5 MW of high-efficiency solar PV modules to NTPC Renewable Energy for projects across Uttar Pradesh.
- Modules will be manufactured using advanced production technology and stringent quality standards to support NTPC Renewable Energy's capacity-expansion program.
- CEO Vinay Thadani says the deal reinforces GREW Solar's role in shaping India's clean-energy landscape.

items.title: India's petrochemical consumption growth to remain at 6-7% annually, capacity expansion to cut imports: Report
items.summary:
- CareEdge: domestic petrochemical demand to grow 6-7% annually in the medium term, driven by economic expansion and steady downstream demand.
- PP capacity to rise ~1.8x FY25–FY30, outpacing demand (~1.4x) and potentially eliminating PP imports by FY30, subject to cost competitiveness.
- Near-term margins pressured by global oversupply and cheap imports; profitability depends on cost competitiveness, global demand-supply, and need-based government support amid ongoing capacity additions.

items.title: New telecom security measures to accelerate indigenous manufacturing, cuts compliance burden: Jyotiraditya Scindia
items.summary:
- DoT/NCCS unveil reforms to strengthen telecom security while easing compliance to boost indigenous manufacturing and testing.
- Extend Pro Tem Security Certification for OEMs by 2 years; cut TSTL fees; 90% relief for women-led/MSME labs; 50% for others; waivers for government agencies and IITs.
- Align with DSS/Make in India/Atmanirbhar Bharat; expand broadband; build Swadeshi testing infra; position Bharat as a trusted global telecom hub.

items.title: From fortress to frontier: How 2025 opened India’s nuclear sector after decades
items.summary:
- SHANTI Bill 2025 allows up to 49% FDI via JVs and private players to build, own, and operate civil reactors with majority domestic ownership by NPCIL-linked groups.
- Focus on SMRs with ₹20,000 crore funding and a target of five indigenous SMRs by 2033 to supplement large reactors.
- Hurdles include high capex, new liability rules, insurance costs, regulatory clarity, and continued government control over sensitive areas like mining and waste.

items.title: Waaree Energies CEO Amit Paithankar to step down; Jignesh Rathod named CEO-designate
RIL denies report on govt seeking $30 billion compensation
India sits on huge rare earth reserves but produces barely 1% of global output: Report
items.summary:
• Global REE reserves ~90–110 Mt; India ~6–7% (~6.9 Mt) but 2024 output was ~2,900 t (7th).
• Monazite-rich coastal sands with thorium trigger strict rules; processing capacity is limited.
• China dominates refining (~90%); India needs execution, processing, and value-chain build-out to translate reserves into influence.

items.title: Saibaba Shiprecycling in cross hairs of scrapping sanctioned oil tanker Sunflower, formerly Nolan
items.summary:
- A US attorney urged Saibaba Shiprecycling LLP to halt scrapping of MV Sunflower (ex-Nolan), OFAC-sanctioned for Iranian oil and tied to Viktor Artemov’s network for Hizballah/IRGC-QF.
- The vessel changed hands (Nebula Nautics → Jaliyan Sustainable Ship Recycling → Saibaba) and was beached at Alang on 24 November 2025 amid a Florida arrest-warrant backdrop.
- The case underlines Alang’s handling of sanctioned ships amid a weak market and the push for green recycling under the IMO Hong Kong Convention.

items.title: Two Chinese airlines plan Airbus jet purchases worth up to $8.2 billion
items.summary:
- Spring Airlines to buy 30 A320neo jets with a list-price cap around $4.13 billion, deliveries 2028-2032.
- Juneyao Airlines to sign an agreement for 25 A320-family jets, about $4.1 billion, deliveries 2028-2032.
- Both deals require government approvals; Airbus had clearance to proceed with 120 previously ordered jets, but progress on new orders remains awaited.

items.title: RVNL emerges lowest bidder for ₹201 crore wagon overhaul workshop in Odisha
items.summary:
- RVNL emerged as the sole bidder for a ₹201.23 crore wagon Periodic Overhaul (POH) workshop at Kantabanji, Odisha, under East Coast Railway.
- It will have a capacity of 200 wagons and be completed in 18 months, with no promoter or related-party transactions involved.
- The project disclosure was made in stock-exchange filings as part of normal business activity.
